label: 宣命
対訳語: an oral edict proclaimed before officialdom
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: an oral edict proclaimed before officialdom, generally from the Daigokuden. In the early eighth century proclamation of oral edicts played an important part in accession rites. Our earliest examples are archived in the Shoku nihongi and date from Mommu Tennō's age. Some fragmentary earlier examples of semmyō inscribed on mokkan have been uncovered as well. [太極殿、続日本紀、文武天皇、木簡]
